sub_title: Senior Inspector Underground Mining at SodM
summary:
A SACNASP registered earth scientist (coal mining geologist -MSc Hydrogeological Engineering) with experience in the Witbank Coal fields, Standerton area and Vaal area in the northern Free State (2014 - 2022) accompanied by Central European experience and post graduate education (2018-2020).

Tasked with geological mapping and drilling (vertical and horizontal), product grade control - QAQC, metallurgical collaboration with the feature of various mining softwares e.g. Stratmodel/Minescape, MicroStation and AcQuire, department-specific budget management, contractor management and mentoring of graduates.
Recently I was specifically tasked with derating (tonnage and quality) reserves of previously underground mined reserves which are now being mined via opencut methods. For this particular project I have pioneered and solely developed the entire procedure, calculations and database interface for the novel task within half the time (6months) assigned to it and created guidelines for the task.

'Anglo American', 'description': 'Geology graduate based at the Witbank Coalfields.
2014 - Greenside Colliery, underground export coal mining in which the geology department is responsible for weekly grade control requiring weekly underground visits to all section faces and correspondence with the wash plant prior to compiling a weekly geology marketing report comprising of yields and CV at which the coal is washed at.
Purely continous mining extraction.

2015 - New Denmark Colliery, Eskom supplier situated in the Standerton area of Mpumalanga.  Underground longwall coal mining in which the geology department is responsible for section measurements and operation of the on-site lab.
Challenging and arduous mining conditions with low seam heights and exponential geological features constantly encountered.
Geophysics plays a crucial role in the geology department as a means of modelling the conditions.

2016 - New Vaal Colliery, Eskom supplier situated in the Vaal area, northern Free State.  Main responsibilities involve seam mining advise to production and coal quality monitoring or grade controlling.  

Field Logging - Surface vertical drilling at both operations is the responsibility of the geology department with the aid of contractors entrusted with operating drill rigs.
Underground directional drilling at Greenside Colliery.
